file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Carrick Station. The threat on Athiss is over, Master Satele. We gathered all the Sith artifacts we could.
More importantly, you returned home safe. The Council no longer feels any disturbance in the Force coming from that world.
Based on your discoveries, we now believe the ruins were once a great city built by a renegade Sith alchemist: Vodal Kressh.
According to these artifacts, Vodal Kressh raised an army to challenge the Emperor's rule. The beings you fought in the ruins were their descendants.
The man who was controlling everyone was a powerful Force user. He'd had training.
Their leader was a Sith.
Many Sith refuse to merge with the Force when they die. It's possible Vodal Kressh still led his remaining followers, but you've ended that.
Maybe the Sith stranded Kressh and his followers on Athiss and abandoned them there?
Is that why the Empire left?
Kressh must have been a considerable threat, if the Emperor's solution was to leave the planet.
I don't care what they were. I'm just glad they're all dead.
What matters is, they're done.
Death and destruction should never be celebrated--but there is some good to come out of this evil.
If Darth Malgus had secured these artifacts--and recruited the enemies you fought--it would have been disastrous.
These corrupted things will be sealed away where the Sith will never find them. We owe you a great debt.
I'm just returning the favors you paid me during my training.
Anytime, Master Satele.
That seems so long ago now.
Surely we stand to learn something from what we recovered. Must we hide the artifacts unexamined?
We should study the artifacts.
Even the most experienced Jedi Master hesitates to work with Sith creations. Knowledge is power, but corrupted knowledge is deadly.
You can help me file a report with Command. They owe me hazard pay for this, but I'm not sure they'll believe my story.
Talk to my superiors.
I will assure the Republic's military leaders of your valor.
Meet me for a meal at the Dealer's Den on Coruscant, and I'll forget all about what you owe me.
[Flirt] Have dinner with me.
I can't accept such a generous offer, Captain. I have you at a disadvantage.
Nothing says "thank you" like hard currency.
I gladly accept credits.
You'll be rewarded for your efforts, of course.
You owe me nothing.
That's a noble gesture. I'll make sure your payment is donated to the needy.
A little fame would be nice.
Your name is already known to those who matter most.
I must report to the Jedi Council and inform them of what we've learned. Thank you again--and may the Force be with you.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Carrick Station on secure channel "ion eight." Do you read?
I'm receiving--and grateful you answered my call. I couldn't have asked for better.
You are one of the order's strongest champions. May your connection to the Force carry us to victory.
You've earned a reputation for bravery. I hope that strength of spirit will be enough for this mission.
Your team must face a powerful dark side presence. Failure to resist its influence could condemn you all to madness... or worse.
You must face a powerful dark side presence and resist its influence. To fail could destroy your sanity... or worse.
Whatever this evil is, I'll face it. I'm not afraid.
I don't fear the dark side.
You should be.
There's something more terrible than dying, or losing my mind?
What could be worse?
Many things. Let's hope you never discover them.
I've beaten everything else. I wouldn't mind adding "insanity" to the list.
Finally, a real challenge.
This is no time for boasting.
We received a distress signal from the planet Athiss. Archaeological survey teams were excavating Sith ruins there. They awakened something while gathering ancient artifacts.
The dark side grows strong within those Sith ruins. And now the Jedi Council senses a profound disturbance in the Force there.
Why would anyone explore Sith ruins in the first place?
People shouldn't be there.
Their discovery was accidental. By the time anyone on the survey team realized exactly what they'd found, it was already too late.
Did this planet once belong to the Sith? Why is the dark side so powerful there?
Tell me about Athiss.
The Sith Empire colonized Athiss millennia ago, but abandoned it for unknown reasons. The explorers thought the world was uninhabited.
If the situation is that bad, shouldn't Jedi Masters be handling it?
Is the Council going, then?
The galaxy is growing unstable. Council members have their own emergencies to deal with. This one is mine--and yours.
The survey team leader said his people were driven mad before being overwhelmed by something inside the ruins. He warned us to quarantine Athiss.
But now, intelligence reports indicate the Sith Empire intercepted those transmissions. Darth Malgus is putting together a strike team as we speak.
We'll put an end to that evil presence before Malgus's lackeys can get anywhere near it.
They'll be too late.
I believe our enemy wants to harness this evil presence. Don't let him succeed.
Malgus must believe whatever is on that world can be useful to the Empire.
Malgus wants something.
I fear he's correct. The Empire has the advantage of knowledge we don't possess.
We should just wait for them to land and flatten the site from orbit. Problem solved.
Let's bomb the ruins.
Members of the survey team may still be alive--and whatever infests the ruins will not be destroyed so easily.
You've hired the right spacer, lady. Being first to the prize is what I'm famous for.
I always win races.
Any relics in those ruins will be corrupted by the dark side. Please don't try to sell them.
That Sith name sounds familiar, but I can't put a face to it.
Who is Darth Malgus?
Darth Malgus is a formidable enemy who will stop at nothing to destroy us. That is all you need know.
I'm sick of the Empire always being one step ahead of us. Whoever is in charge of keeping our secrets is fired.
Our security is worthless.
In moments like these, I cannot disagree with your assessment.
Whatever evil presence has been unleashed on Athiss must not be allowed to escape--or worse, become a weapon of the Empire.
Take a shuttle, end the dark side threat and gather all the Sith relics you find for study and containment. May the Force be with you.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
